oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Engravings of the Fenian Congress at the Assembly Building, Philadelphia, Oct. 16 and the execution of Champ Ferguson, at Nashville, Oct. 29
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two engravings. The second is of Champ Ferguson on the gallows with soldiers at guard and a crowd watching

Confederate guerilla Champ Ferguson was infamous for his partisan raids on suspected Union sympathizers in East Tennessee and the Cumberland Plateau. He was executed for war crimes on October 20, 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ferguson, Champ, 1821-1865; Guerrillas--Confederate States of America--Biography; Confederate States of America--History; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865
Engravings; Gallows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: J. F. Wagner
